applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to the document for several reasons: 1) The document describes standalone pension life cover scheme rules that operate independently and are not contingent on purchasing other financial services. 2) The scheme is specifically designed as an occupational pension scheme with the sole purpose of providing death benefits, as clearly stated in Section 3.4: 'The main purpose of the scheme is to provide benefits for the member's dependants if the member dies before normal retirement age.' 3) There is no language in the document suggesting that purchase of this pension life cover scheme is contingent on buying other financial services from AIB life or connected parties. 4) The document outlines a complete, standalone product governed by pension legislation and Revenue requirements rather than a bundled or contingent financial service. The rules describe a discrete pension product that can be purchased independently of other financial services.
regulation_title: No sale of financial service to be made contingent on purchase of another financial service
regulation_text: 90. (1) A regulated entity shall not make the sale of a financial service contingent on a consumer purchasing another financial service from the regulated entity or a connected party of the regulated entity. (2) Paragraph (1) does not prevent a regulated entity from offering additional financial services to consumers who are existing customers which are not available to consumers that are potential customers. (3) This Regulation does not apply in respect of payment accounts with basic features provided by relevant credit institutions coming within the scope of the European Union (Payment Accounts) Regulations 2016 (S.I. No. 482 of 2016).
